items.title: FSN E-commerce stock in the radar with mid-twenties revenue surge in Q2
items.description: Nomura saw FSN E-commerce's Q2 revenue growth in a positive light, suggesting that improvement for the company was on track, led by its beauty and personal care segment.

items.title: Paras Defence closes QIP, sets issue price at Rs 1,045 per share; stock in focus
items.description: Paras Defence closes its QIP issue, setting the share price at Rs 1,045, after raising funds by allotting 12.93 lakh shares. So far in 2024, the stock has risen 36 percent.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty indicates a negative start; US, Asian markets fall
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street's three major indexes closed down around 1% on Monday while Treasury yields rose, as traders tamped down bets for Federal Reserve interest-rate easing and worried about the Middle East conflict's impact on oil prices. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 398.51 points, or 0.94%, to 41,954.24, the S&P 500 lost 55.13 points, or 0.96%, to 5,695.94 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 213.94 points, or 1.18%, to 17,923.90.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade HDFC Bank, Infosys, eMudhra, RR Kabel, Vedanta and others on Tuesday?
items.description: The market is likely to extend its southward journey if it fails to hold the previous day's low. Until then, consolidation can't be ruled out. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Stock Radar: Tata Motors, Nykaa, Zodiac Energy, BEL, Eraaya Lifespaces, Hi-Tech Pipes in focus on Tuesday
items.description: Swelect Energy Systems, Puravankara, HDFC Bank, IRCON International, HEG, Cholamandalam Investment and Finance Company, Lemon Tree Hotels, and Exicom Tele-Systems will also be in focus on October 8.

items.title: Nifty down 6% from record peaks; worst yet to come? | HDFC Bank, Nykaa in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: Indian benchmarks Sensex and Nifty extended selloff to sixth straight day as fears of ongoing geopolitical tensions and China opportunistic continued to rattle investors. Barring Nifty IT, all sectors nosedived in the sea of red, wiping off Rs 25 lakh crore investor wealth. Going ahead, experts expect Nifty to face resistance at 25,000, with support around 24,500. This morning global cues are mixed. US markets ended lower overnight, while Chinese markets led gains in Asia-Pacific markets. Meanwhile, brent crude holds above $80 per barrel, its highest level since August. Among stocks in focus, watch out for HDFC Bank, Nykaa, Sobha, among others. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Ajit Mishra, Senior Vice President- Research, Religare Broking and Raj Vyas, Vice-President - Research, Teji Mandi.

items.title: BEL bags additional orders worth over Rs 500 crore, stock in focus
